comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.hallofgovernors.ny.gov/JohnDix38th "John Alden Dix (1860–1928) was the Democratic Party chairman when he successfully sought the governorship in 1910. As governor, Dix created the State Conservation Commission, approved legislation authorizing direct primary elections, and improved state highways. Following the deadly Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire of 1911, Dix helped pass the “one-day-of-rest-in-seven” law that limited the number of working hours for women and children and improved working conditions in factories."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Political Graveyard politicalgraveyard.com/bio/diperna-dix.html names his wife as Gertrude Thomson. More details on her at www.sackettfamily.info/tekdatabase/g36/p36176.htm
